TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IDesignerGlyphProvider

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The System.Workflow.* types are deprecated. Instead, please use the new types from System.Activities.*")

Docs.summary: Defines the method that glyph provider classes use to generate an array of glyphs to display on an activity designer.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > [!INCLUDE[DeprecatedContent](~/includes/deprecatedcontent-md.md)]
This interface defines the method that implementing classes must use to provide an appropriate set of <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerGlyph> objects to activity designers. The implementing class should also render the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerGlyph> objects onto the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner> object.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how you can implement the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.IDesignerGlyphProvider> interface. It shows how you can implement the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.IDesignerGlyphProvider.GetGlyphs%2A> method to draw custom glyph objects on an activity designer surface.
This code example is part of the Workflow Monitor SDK Sample from the DesignerGlyphProvider.cs file. For more information, see [Workflow Monitor](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/4f70c1c5-f82d-4d5f-8b7d-943b9f99f8e2).
[!code-csharp[WF_Samples#130](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/wf_samples/cs/snippets1.cs#130)] [!code-vb[WF_Samples#130](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/wf_samples/vb/snippets1.vb#130)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesignerGlyphCollection GetGlyphs(class System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner activityDesigner) cil managed

Docs.param: The object for which to retrieve the glyphs.
Docs.summary: Returns an array of glyphs that are associated with the specified activity designer.
Docs.returns: An array of objects to render to the activity designer.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how you can implement the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.IDesignerGlyphProvider.GetGlyphs%2A> method to draw custom glyph objects on an activity designer surface.
This code example is part of the Workflow Monitor SDK Sample from the DesignerGlyphProvider.cs file. For more information, see [Workflow Monitor](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/4f70c1c5-f82d-4d5f-8b7d-943b9f99f8e2).
